Grouped_Utterances: I’d like to talk about my feelings regarding my son’s death. It’s been on my mind lately.

Yes, I feel less anxious when I take that time for myself. It felt relieving. I didn’t realize how much I needed to talk about it. There were a couple of times I felt guilty for saying no, but overall, I’m managing. He’s been improving slowly, which is encouraging. I’m hopeful. It’s nice to see him getting better. Mostly when I start to feel overwhelmed or anxious about my friend’s situation. I’ve been reflecting on how I handled that experience and if I could have done anything differently. I feel a mix of sadness and guilt, wondering if I made the right decisions. Not really. I keep it to myself.
I did! We had a good conversation, and he was very supportive.

I’ve been okay, trying to stick to the self-care schedule we talked about. It’s been helpful. I’ve been drawing more and making time to relax. Yes, I’ve started saying no to some things that I know I can’t handle. He hasn’t pushed back, which is good. I think he understands I need to take care of myself too. I try to focus on the positive aspects of taking care of myself.
I’ve been practicing that breathing technique we discussed, and it helps.

I might. It could be beneficial to talk to someone who understands. That sounds like a positive step. Processing grief can be a long journey, and it’s okay to seek support along the way. How do you feel about setting a goal to reach out this week? I think I can do that.
